author: Vivek Narayanan
text:
As of date, there are around 3,000 gun owners in the city

Licensed gun owners in the city have begun depositing their firearms with the police and private armouries ahead of the Assembly elections scheduled for May 16.

However, many prefer private armouries as there is no adequate space at the police stations.

According to the police, licence- holders are mandated to deposit their guns at the time of elections.

As on date, there are around 3,000 licensed gun owners in the city.

“Many have started depositing their firearms. Most of the guns are of non-prohibited bore-like single- and double-barrel guns, rifles, revolvers and pistols,” said P. K. Sathyanarayanan, proprietor of Tamil Nadu Armoury, Saidapet.

“Many keep guns for self-protection and some as a hobby. Then, there are politicians, businessmen, cine actors and industrialists who own guns. Details about the ammunition purchased by them are also maintained at a few police stations,” said a licensed gun owner.

“Maintenance of guns is not good in police stations. Hence, there is usually a rush in armouries,” he added. As per the rules, the guns are supposed to be deposited with private armouries or the jurisdictional police station.

“It will be kept safely till the elections are over. However, rifle club members, security guards and those escorting vans carrying cash to banks and ATMs are exempted from handing over their guns. Action will be taken against those who fail to deposit their guns,” said a police officer.

Meanwhile the police have also started planning for a strong security cover for the elections.

“There are over 7,400 booths. Out of this, 577 booths in 261 localities have been identified as sensitive. Discussions are on to decide on security measures for these booths,” added an officer.

“The anti-gangster squads of the city police and the intelligence units keep a track on gangsters and habitual offenders to ensure that they do not plot any attack,” said the officer.

title: Licence-holders begin depositing firearms
